text:
Manchester is indeed a great city and it has an amazing student culture.
IBFE is a challenging major but it allows to study key courses from various fields, so I am really glad I chose it.

About the experience, I have had a few internships already in diverse firms, and now I just started one at a trading and brokering firm in Morocco.
Indeed, I know M&A has long hours, but it is a really fun field and I like looking at the statements of companies and using valuation methods (I ve learned some at university) so I am looking forward to working there soon.
Thanks for the recommendation of John Grisham. I have just read a plot of one of his novels (the firm) and it sounds really exciting. I am going to buy it as soon as I am back in Manchester.
EY sounds like a good firm and it is indeed one of the Big4, so I guess it is a nice place to work at.
As for internships, I applied a bit late so was not successful in securing anything to be honest; however, as I am doing a Masters after graduation, so I will apply for next summer as well. By the way, can I have your LinkedIn address? I would definitely benefit having you as a connection.
